pr_title: rls: lb policy config object & ChildPolicyReportingHelper

timeline.bodyText: I don't see its entries are used in this class and I don't see any getter of it. How is this map going to be used?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: oops, yes this is no longer used (moved to PendingCacheEntry which contains BackoffPolicy so we don't need to maintain a map). removed.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: Can helper be final? Is there a case it could change?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: the helper won't be changed once it is set. if we want to make it final, the caller may need to create a delegating helper (this will be next PR depends on this change) even if it will use the cached version.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: Can this be final? Is there a case it could change?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: same as helper, it is used like final but it will be set after the caller find out that it is a brand new ChildPolicyWrapper. unlike helper it doesn't create extra object. do you think it is better to pass helper and childPolicy to the factory method to make it final?
replies.author: creamsoup

replies.bodyText: Yes, it would be definitely better to make it final unless there is restriction such as the helper and childPolicy are unknown when it has to be instantiated. Would that be difficult?
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: i had to bring in the other helper due to circular dependency if it just accept helper in actual lb impl. PTAL
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: This map is shared for the whole JVM for all channels to totally different servers. This worries me.  Also the map needs synchronization.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: yes target can be same. good catch. i refactored out this factory part. it is not globally shared, i didn't add any synchronization. future implementation always call it with lock if this can justify it.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: Seems you can just implement LrsLoadBalancerProvider.parseLoadBalancingPolicyConfig() by merging master.  Return ConfigOrError instead of throw.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: discussed offline, the RlsLbProvider.parseLoadBalancingPolicyConfig() has more logic than just parsing ChildLoadBalancingPolicy. to imply the parsing can be fail, it will throw checked exception.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.message: move factory method out of ChildPolicyWrapper

timeline.bodyText: Maybe you can turn off writableStackTrace.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: What's the expected usecase here? getObject() once and returnObject() twice()?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: this handles when the object is just released, free up the reference.
replies.author: creamsoup

replies.bodyText: If you call x times getObject(), you need call x+1 times of returnObject() to get here, is that the contract?
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: create itself is counted as getObject() since the object is passed in.
replies.author: creamsoup

replies.bodyText:
create itself is counted as getObject()

But you can not use the object unless you call getObject() explicitly.  The API contract looks strange.  If you just need to use the object once, you have to explicitly call  getObject() once, and you need returnObject() twice to get here.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: why it cannot use the object before getObject()? anyways, okay it depends on what is the focus. focused more on the "RefCounted" it makes more sense to have it as 1, if you focused more on "ObjectPool" part starting with 0 makes more sense. refCount = 0 is released state (ref counted bytebuf starts with 1 for example), but for the sake of consistency i can follow the other convention, also it implements ObjectPool makes me leaning toward that.
replies.author: creamsoup
dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText:
This circular dependency looks weird, because ChildPolicyWrapper is consumed by new ChildPolicyReportingHelper() before instantiation is complete.
The two classes are tightly coupled. Making ChildPolicyReportingHelper an inner (non-static) class of ChildPolicyWrapper might be more natural.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: yes i was wondering same thing.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: not used yet. this will be used by fallback channel.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: good catch!
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: nit: The listener interface is nested too deep. Can be one level up.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText:
This API should always return null.
https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/v1.28.1/core/src/main/java/io/grpc/internal/ObjectPool.java#L32-L36
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Might need introduce something like isReleased()
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: tried to avoid additional check, but this sounds better.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.message: make objectpool non static, make returnObject returns null

Revert "make objectpool non static, make returnObject returns null"

This reverts commit e170906d94f7c5a23d9a67421458e0c7163e1794.
